lines.text: So, are you as good in bed as you are on that dance floor?
You know, Connie, if you're as good in bed as you are on the dance floor, then you're one lousy fuck.
Then how come they always send me flowers the next morning?
I dunno. Maybe they thought you was dead.
You can save a little, build a future.
Oh fuck the future!
No, Tony! You can't fuck the future. The future fucks you! It catches up with you and it fucks you if you ain't planned for it?
Look, tonight is the future, and I am planning for it! There's this shirt I gotta buy, a beautiful shirt.
Would ya just watch the hair. Ya know, I work on my hair a long time and you hit it. He hits my hair.
There's ways of killing yourself without killing yourself.
You know, you and I got the same last initial.

[sarcastically]
Wow. Does that mean when we get married I won't have to change the monogram on my luggage?
Al Pacino! Attica! Attica! Attica!

[to Tony]
Can I wipe your forehead?

[commenting on Tony's four dollar raise in salary]
Four dollars? You know what four dollars buys today? It don't ever buy three dollars!
I don't see no one givin' you a raise down at unemployment.
Four dollars? Shit!

I knew you'd piss on it. Go on, just piss on it, alright? A raise says like you're good, you know? You know how many times someone told me I was good in my life? Two! Twice! Two fuckin' times! This raise today, and dancing at the disco!
[Gets up and walks out of the room]
You sure as fuck never did! Asshole!
My girlfriend, she loves the taste of communion wafers.
If you put your dick in a spic, does it get bigger than a nigger?
if you had to make a choice between getting an abortion and having to get married, what would you do?
Well, who would I have to marry?
You'd have to marry me.
I think I'd get an abortion.
You make it with some of these chicks, they think you gotta dance with them.
She can dance, you know that? She's got the wrong partner of course, but she can dance.
So then why don't you ask her?
Fuck you.
Which position?

[Tony Manero makes his way onto the dance floor at 2001 Odyssey, dancing with two girls]
Kiss me.
[Tony ignores her request]
KISS ME!
[Tony kisses her]
Ohh, I just kissed Al Pacino!

[to Tony as he walks in the house]
Where you been?
[he doesn't answer]
Your mother wants to know where you been. Where you been?
Your father's askin' ya! Where you been?
You know all about the bridge, don't you?
I know everything about that bridge.
Know what else? There's a guy buried in the cement
Really?
Know how it happened? While they were working on it, pouring the cement, he slipped off on the upper part of the bridge and, you know, fell in... Dumb fuck.
Nice move. Did you make that up?
Yeah, well I saw it on TV first, then I made it up.
Are you a nice girl or are you a cunt?
Can't I be both?
No. It's a decision a girl's gotta make early in life, if she's gonna be a nice girl or a cunt.
Ain't ya gonna ask me to sit down?
No, 'cause you would do it.
Bet you'd ask me to lay down.
No, you would not do it.
Why are you such a cocktease?
Don't you call me no goddamned cocktease!
Tony, the only way you're gonna survive is to do what you think is right, not what they keep trying to jam you into. You let 'em do that and you're gonna end up in nothing but misery!
Hey Tony, Double J's been in the car twenty-five minutes with some chick!
So?
So, I can't get the selfish prick out!

[to Annette]
These guys can't do nothin' without me.
I gotta have an afternoon off, and I'm takin' it.
If you do, you're fired.
I'm DOIN' it!
Then you're FIRED!
Then fuck you, asshole!
...And the horse you rode in on.
Hey, you know you assholes almost broke my pussy finger.
Oh yeah, you wouldn't know which one it was.

[to a girl he just got done having sex with]
What did you say your name was?

[as he watches Bobby C. fall]
"God gave His only son."

[walks into clothing store after seeing silk shirt in window]
You do lay-away?
As long as it doesn't turn into a ten-year mortgage.

[hands salesman some cash and prepares to leave]
I want that shirt in the window.
Wait, let me get you a receipt.

[still walking out]
I trust you.
No... DON'T trust me!
You had coffee with Joe Namath?
Yeah! He asked me what it was like to be 21, and I told him I didn't know, 'cause I was just twenty.
Then what?
That's all.

[with his mouth full]
Ain't that enough?
Hey, don't you never chew, Tony? Don't you never chew?

[annoyed]
Hey, when my mother dies, I'll give you the job, all right?
I'm sick of guys who ain't got their shit together!
Well, all ya need is a salad bowl, and a potato masher,
[he mimics stirring in a bowl]
and you got your shit together!
You know what Gus, I feel like breaking your broken legs!
[repeated line]
Aw, Jesus...
